DELTA AIR LINES
OCCUPÉ
OCCUPIED
CUPAD

PORTABLE RADIO (AM OR FM)
OR TV RECEIVERS MAY NOT BE
OPERATED WHILE AIRCRAFT IS
IN FLIGHT.
Portable radios (AM or FM) and TV receivers
may have circuits which radiate signals.
These circuits act like miniature broad-
casting stations and, in some cases, these
signals are strong enough to interfere with
the aircraft's radio navigation systems.
In recognition of this and to insure your
safety, all airlines found it necessary to
prohibit the use of any AM or FM radio or
TV receivers in flight.
Dictating devices may be used while aircraft
is in flight.
Thank you for your cooperation.
DELTA
AIR LINES
Form 0412 80071
Rev. 11-65

THIS IS YOUR
SAFETY
INFORMATION
DELTA
AIR LINES

How Delta's wings
have spread across
the nation...
border-to-border
and coast-to-coast
The men and women of Delta take pride in a heritage of hospitable,
helpful service that dates back to pioneering days in 1929 when Delta
carried the first passengers between Atlanta and Dallas. Following
World War II, Delta's growth throughout the South was steady,
reaching to New York in 1956 and to the West Coast in 1961. In 1959
and 1960, Delta was first to fly the new Big Jets over most of its
routes, and then began the giant strides that have made it fifth in size
among all U.S. air lines. Delta also is seventh among world carriers
with over 14,000 route miles in the U.S. and the Caribbean.
Even Europe is now linked to the Southeast through a daily joint
service of Delta and Pan American.
OFFERED BY DELTA
LEGEND

Delta's modern jet fleet includes the Convair 880
Jetliner

EMERGENCY EXITS
Door and window exits are clearly
labeled (see diagrams). Window exits
are in the middle of the cabin leading
onto the wings. To unlock and open,
pull handle above window. A life line,
located in top of exit, serves as an aid
in leaving the aircraft when fully ex-
tended.

LIFE RAFTS
Enough rafts are aboard for everyone,
each with room for twenty-five people.
Every raft contains emergency rations,
first aid and water distilling kits and
many other useful items. Your highly
trained crew will launch the rafts and
explain their use.
(INTERNATIONAL FLIGHTS ONLY)

properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of David A. Abercrombie in memory of Stanley A. Abercrombie
properties.sfomuseum:description: Flight information packet issued by Delta Air Lines, comprising:a. information pamphlet with back pocket; multipage booklet; white cover with full color illustration of a flight attendant and text “Welcome aboard Delta”;b. postcard with full color photographic image of Convair 880 in flight;c. seat occupied card; single-sided white, red, and gray card;d. flyer describing airline policy on portable radios and televisions; single-sided card;e. route map; system service routes; fold-out format;f. safety information pamphlet for assorted aircraft; fold-out format.
properties.wof:name: flight information packet: Delta Air Lines
